page.title: 10A Forester's Year
page.content: In January and February a forester's main job is thinning out the trees and taking the timber away.In March planting begins and preparing the seed beds.If the weather is mild, sowing begins.In April and May weeding is the main job.In June, July and August the fences have to be checked and repaired if necessary to stop rabbits, sheep and deer from entering the woods.In September,October and November weeding and transplanting may take place.In December "Christmas Trees" are harvested. The timber to be cut is marked and felled using a chain saw. The stump is treated with a chemical to stop fungus growing.The side branches are removed with an axe and used for stakes, posts, pit-props and pallettes. Larger timber is used for pulp and sawlogs.
